result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant Billy W Hill in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of the Criminal Complaint and requests counsel. Defendant is going to apply at the Public Defender's Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
GIVEN TO THE DEFENDANT IN COURT

$200.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody,.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
 - Todd Lemay @ 1912 Madison Street, Two Rivers, WI
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-09-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct-dvo and violate 72 hour no contact provision.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-15-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.   Bail is set at $200.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with D.R.W., DOB: 11-09-1971 and 1917 Madison Street, Two Rivers, WI.  Court will allow a one time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
